CONSULTANT CONFIDENTIALITY, SERVICE AND NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT


THIS CONSULTANT CONFIDENTIALITY, SERVICE AND NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT (hereinafter referred to as "Agreement") IS MADE AS OF {{ frappe.format_date(doc.date_of_joining, "dd MMM, yyyy") }},

between

{{ doc.company }}, having its registered office at 7th Floor, Shaligram Corporates, C. J. Road, Iscon - Ambli Road, Ahmedabad, Gujarat - 380058 (India) and its subsidiaries, affiliates, successors or assigns (hereinafter referred to as "Company"), and


{{ doc.employee_name }}, having its address at: S/o {{ doc.middle_name }}, H.no : {{ doc.custom_permanent_address_line_1 }}{% if doc.custom_permanent_address_line_2 %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_address_line_2 }}{% endif %}{% if doc.custom_permanent_address_line_3 %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_address_line_3 }}{% endif %}{% if doc.custom_permanent_city %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_city }}{% endif %}{% if doc.custom_permanent_sub_district %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_sub_district }}{% endif %}{% if doc.custom_permanent_district %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_district }}{% endif %}{% if doc.custom_permanent_state %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_state }}{% endif %}{% if doc.custom_permanent_country %}, {{ doc.custom_permanent_country }}{% endif %} Pincode: {{doc.custom_permanent_zip_code}} (hereinafter referred to as "Consultant"). Whereas {{ doc.employee_name }} is providing consulting services in connection with {{ doc.company }}.


In consideration of the consultancy provided by CONSULTANT's to the Company, all associated compensation and other good and valuable consideration, with the intention that this Agreement shall apply to the entire period of CONSULTANT's engagement with the Company (including the period prior to the date of this Agreement), the CONSULTANT hereby agrees to the following terms & conditions:


  1. Confidential Information defined: The services and obligations which the CONSULTANT has agreed to undertake on behalf of the Company require him to have access to and knowledge of certain confidential information. This confidential information may include, but is not limited to computerized data, methods, design information, technical information, inventions, discoveries, improvement, development tools, machine, apparatus, appliances, designs, works of authorship, logo, systems, promotional ideas, concepts, formulae, techniques, trade secrets, products and /or research related to the actual or anticipated research development, plans for further development, customer lists, organization of the company, Company standards and other confidential proprietary information belonging to or licensed to, the Company or its clients or Customers, including but not limited to trade, secrets, inventions, patents and copyrighted materials (hereinafter referred to as “Confidential Information”).

    Confidential Information may be in any form, including but not limited to all oral, written, graphic and electromagnetic information and/or physical models, observation, data, written material, records, documents, drawings, photographs, computer programmes, information related to the Company and of its any division/plant/site in any manner whether in hard copy or soft copy, its affiliates or related entities and any other information of similar nature that is not available to the public.

  2. Non-Disclosure of Confidential Information of the Company: The CONSULTANT also understands that access to all confidential information is granted on a need to know basis, i.e. information access that is required in order to perform work for the Company. The CONSULTANT acknowledges that, during the period of his engagement with the Company, it will have access to Confidential Information of the Company. Therefore, CONSULTANT agrees that both, during and after the period of its engagement with the Company, the CONSULTANT shall not, without the prior written approval of the Company, directly or indirectly:
    1. reveal, report, publish, disclose or transfer any Confidential Information of the Company to any third party, including but not limited to friends, relatives, co-workers; or
      use any Confidential Information of the Company for any purpose or for the benefit of any
    2. person or entity, except as pursuant to the policies and applicable law or as necessary in the performance of the CONSULTANT's work for the Company, with due permission and knowledge of the Company, and if such disclosure is required under law to statutory authorities, the CONSULTANT shall inform the company in writing before any such disclosure.

    By signing the agreement, the CONSULTANT affirms that he will protect all confidential information while engaged by the Company and after he completes all services and obligations for the Company. The CONSULTANT affirms that all confidential information remains the property of the Company, and shall not be removed, retained or disclosed even after he discharges his services and obligations towards the Company, except with explicit permission granted by the Company.

  3. Non-Disclosure of Confidential Information of Others: The CONSULTANT acknowledges that during the period of his engagement with the Company, he may have had or will have access to Confidential Information of third parties who have given the Company the right to use such Confidential Information, whether in hard copy or soft copy, subject to a non-disclosure agreement between the Company and such third party. Therefore, the CONSULTANT agrees that both during and after the period of his engagement with the Company, he shall not, without the prior written approval of the Company, directly or indirectly (a) reveal, report, publish, disclose or transfer any Confidential Information of such third parties to any person or entity; or (b) use any Confidential Information of such third parties for any purpose or for the benefit of any person or entity, except as may be necessary in the performance of CONSULTANT's work for the Company, and for the purpose for which the confidential information is provided with explicit permission granted by the Company; or (c) if such disclosure is required under law to statutory authorities, the Consultant shall inform the Company in writing before any such disclosure.

  4. Payment: The Company shall pay Consultant Rs.13000 /- for the services being availed from you as a part of the payment Schedule. The payment will be made on monthly basis based on the installations successfully accomplished & certified by the competent authorities. You shall submit a duly stamped & signed installation report with clearly filled all the columns & mentioning all spares which have been used during the installation process. TDS will be applicable as per Income Tax Law.

  5. I.P Protection: The CONSULTANT agrees that the Company is the exclusive owner of Confidential Information along with the copyrights, trademarks, service marks, logos, trade names, trade dress and other intellectual and proprietary rights (“Intellectual Property Rights”) associated with the business of the Company, which may be protected by copyright, patent, trademark and other applicable intellectual property and proprietary rights and laws.

    The CONSULTANT acknowledges that the Confidential Information consists of original works and has been developed, compiled, prepared, revised, selected and arranged by the Company through the application of methods and standards of judgment developed and applied through the expenditure of substantial time, effort, and money and constitutes valuable intellectual property of the Company.

    The CONSULTANT shall not distribute, reproduce, duplicate, reverse engineer, or disassemble in any medium any part of the Confidential Information or access, monitor or copy any part of the Confidential Information using any automated or manual process, or any robot, spider, scraper or by any other means for any other purposes whatsoever without the Company’s prior written authorization.

    The CONSULTANT shall not remove, alter, bypass or avoid in any medium any part of the copyright, trademark, or other proprietary notices in relation to the Confidential Information of the Company or circumvent any other measures used to limit or prevent access to the Company’s Confidential Information or “frame, “mirror” or incorporate any part of the Company’s Confidential Information without the Company’s prior written authorization. The CONSULTANT shall not, without the Company’s prior written consent, create derivative works or materials that otherwise are derived from or based on the Confidential Information, including montages, mash-ups and similar videos, wallpaper and desktop themes, etc.

    Finally, while and after having access to the Company’s Confidential Information, the CONSULTANT agrees not to take any action that, in the Company’s sole discretion, infringes upon the Company’s Confidential Information.

  6. Property of the Company: The CONSULTANT acknowledges and agrees that all Confidential Information of the company in any form, whether made or compiled by the CONSULTANT or made available to CONSULTANT during the period of CONSULTANT’s engagement with the Company (including the period before the date of this Agreement) concerning the Company’s Confidential Information, is and shall remain the Company’s property and shall be delivered to the Company immediately on the termination of such engagement with the Company or at any earlier time on the instructions of the Company. The CONSULTANT shall not retain copies of such Confidential Information.

  7. Proprietary Notices: The CONSULTANT shall not permit any other person to remove any proprietary or other legends or restrictive notices contained in or included in any Confidential information. The CONSULTANT undertakes that in the event of its coming to his notice that any such Confidential information is attempted to be accessed or disclosed by any unauthorized user, he shall immediately put the Company to notice thereof.

  8. Representations: The CONSULTANT represents that he has the right to enter into this Agreement, and that his performance of all the terms of this Agreement and duties as an CONSULTANT of the Company will not breach any confidential information agreement, non-competition agreement, trade secrets or proprietary information or other agreement with any former employer of his services, either as an employee, advisor, contractor or independent consultant, or with any other party.

  9. Disclosure of this Agreement: The CONSULTANT hereby authorizes the Company to notify others, including customers of the Company and any of the CONSULTANT's past or future employers, of the terms of this Agreement and the CONSULTANT’s responsibilities under this Agreement.
    10. Termination: This Agreement shall terminate forthwith on the below mentioned aspects:
  10. Specific Performance: The CONSULTANT hereby undertakes to indemnify the Company from and against any losses, damages, cost, charges and expenses whatsoever, which the Company may suffer or incur or be liable for as a result of any breach of trust or duties /obligation on the part of the CONSULTANT.

  11. No Rights Granted: The CONSULTANT understands that nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to constitute, by implication or otherwise, the grant by the Company to the CONSULTANT of any license or other right under any patent, patent application or other intellectual property right or interest belonging to the Company.

  12. Transfer: The CONSULTANT agrees that the Company shall be entitled to transfer the CONSULTANT at any time during the course of employment with the Company to any of the company's affiliates, subsidiaries or sister companies or any of its branches and the CONSULTANT shall comply with all directions and instructions in this regard. Such transfer shall not operate to terminate or modify this Agreement except that the Company to which the CONSULTANT is transferred shall be construed for the purpose of this Agreement as standing in the same place and stand as the Company as the date of transfer.

  13. Renewal: This Contract can be renewed after the expiry at the market rate unless after the period of 11 months, after mutual consultation and agreement with both the parties.

  14. Termination: This Agreement shall terminate forthwith on the below mentioned aspects:
    1. Death of the CONSULTANT

    2. Dissolution or winding up of the Company otherwise than on merger, amalgamation or transfer of the entire business of the Company.

    Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, the Company shall be entitled by giving the CONSULTANT, not less than two months prior written notice and on expiry of the period of such notice, this Agreement shall stand terminated. Even in such eventuality the obligation of the CONSULTANT and all the rights and remedies of the Company shall continue and remain in force and the CONSULTANT shall have to fulfill all the obligations in relation to Confidential Information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

  15. Waiver: No forbearance, indulgence or relaxation by the Company at any time to require performance of any provision of this agreement shall in any way effect, diminish or prejudice the right of such party to receive performance of that provision and any waiver by the other party of any breach of any provision of this agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of any continuing or succeeding breach of such provisions or waiver or any amendments of the provision itself or waiver of any right under or arising out of this agreement

  16. Return of materials: The CONSULTANT undertakes that at the time of leaving the employment of the Company, he will return to the Company all papers, drawings, notes, memoranda, manuals, specifications, designs, devices, documents, diskettes, CD’s, DVD’s. Tapes, DAT Drives and any other material on any media containing or disclosing any Confidential Information, and any other property belonging to the Company.

  17. Severability: Each of the covenants provided in this Agreement are separate and independent covenants. If any provision of this Agreement shall be determined to be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of this Agreement shall not be affected thereby, and any such invalid or unenforceable provision shall be reformed so as to be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law. Further, it is not a defense to the enforcement of any provision of this Agreement that the Company has breached or failed to perform any obligation or covenant hereunder or under any other agreement or understanding between CONSULTANT and the Company.

  18. Governing Law and Jurisdiction: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India and any disputes, controversies or claims arising out of this Agreement or any provisions stated herein shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Ahmedabad.

  19. Amendments: This Agreement may not be changed or modified in whole or in part except by an instrument in writing, agreed to and signed by the CONSULTANT and a duly authorized officer of the Company.

  20. Survival: Expiration or termination of this Agreement shall not relieve the CONSULTANT from its obligations arising hereunder prior to such expiration or termination. Rights and obligations which by their nature should survive, shall remain in effect after termination or expiration of this Agreement.

  21. Acknowledgements: The CONSULTANT acknowledges that the CONSULTANT has read and fully understands this agreement; (ii) the CONSULTANT has been given the opportunity to ask questions; (iii) the CONSULTANT has received a copy of this Agreement, the original of which will be retained by the Company; and (iv) the CONSULTANT's obligations under this Agreement survive the termination of the CONSULTANT's employment with the Company for any reason.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.

AGREED AND ACCEPTED BY:



For, {{doc.company}} CONSULTANT
